meanings.definition: A building or room used for Christian baptism.
meanings.sent1: The small baptistries in the church were beautifully decorated.
meanings.sent2: The baptistries were filled with water for the baptism ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The baptistries were so tiny that only one person could fit inside at a time.
meanings.sent4: The baptistries stood like silent witnesses to the sacred act of baptism.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight streaming into the baptistries created a peaceful atmosphere for the ceremony.

meanings.definition: The part of a church used for baptism.
meanings.sent1: The priest led the group to the baptistries for the baptism.
meanings.sent2: The baptistries were adorned with beautiful stained glass windows.
meanings.sent3: The baptistries echoed with the sounds of joyful hymns during the baptism.
meanings.sent4: The baptistries symbolized a new beginning for those being baptized.
meanings.sent5: The baptistries were the heart of the church, where new members were welcomed into the faith.
